channel.title: Run Server
channel.description:
Whenever i try to run my server this happens
[10/27/10 2:23 AM]: Running RuneSpace [10/27/10 2:23 AM]: Exception in thread "main" [10/27/10 2:23 AM]: java.net.Bind Exception: Address already in use: bind [10/27/10 2:23 AM]: at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method) [10/27/10 2:23 AM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(ServerSocketC hannelImpl.java:119) [10/27/10 2:23 AM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(ServerSocketAdapt or.java:59) [10/27/10 2:23 AM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.r egisterNew(SocketAcceptor.java:363) [10/27/10 2:23 AM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.a ccess$800(SocketAcceptor.java:55) [10/27/10 2:23 AM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor$W orker.run(SocketAcceptor.java:222) [10/27/10 2:23 AM]: at org.apache.mina.util.NamePreservingRunnable.run(NameP reservingRunnable.java:51) [10/27/10 2:23 AM]: at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619) Press any key to continue . . .
This has never happened before. Whats it mean :L

item.title: Run Server
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Well I notice apache and address already in use, are you trying to open some kind of URL or socket to the web? Are you closing the socket after you’re finished with it or are you trying to create multiple connections?

I’m really not sure but that’s my best guess.

Read full topic
